title.value: Latent Space Evolution under Incremental Learning with Concept Drift (Student Abstract)
title.justification: The title is explicitly provided at the top of the research paper.
title.quote: Latent Space Evolution under Incremental Learning with Concept Drift (Student Abstract)

extractions.description: This work investigates the evolution of latent space when deep learning models are trained incrementally in non-stationary environments caused by virtual concept drift. The paper proposes a methodology for visualizing changes in latent representations and demonstrates how classes not targeted by concept drift can be negatively affected.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and qualitative analysis to support its findings, indicating an empirical study.
type.quote: In the following section, we investigate the performance impact of incrementally learning from an environment which undergoes virtual concept drift. Using the well-known MNIST dataset ... We first show that in a non-stationary environment, ... These results are supported by our final qualitative analysis of the latent representation evolution.

name.justification: The primary focus of the paper is on incremental learning in non-stationary environments.
name.quote: Incremental Learning consists in pursuing the training of a model on new data without accessing previous data.

name.justification: The study specifically addresses issues related to concept drift and its impact on incremental learning.
name.quote: This work investigates the evolution of latent space when deep learning models are trained incrementally in non-stationary environments that stem from concept drift.

name.justification: The paper uses a multi-layer perceptron with two hidden layers as the deep neural network for the experiments.
name.quote: We use a multi-layer perceptron with two hidden layers of width 20, optimized over a cross entropy loss using SGD and learning rate of 0.05.
